Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/64.129.171.85|64.129.171.85]] ([[User talk:64.129.171.85|talk]]) to last version by GregorB
just removed one comma... grammar freak here :P
/* Labor union opposition */ removed ungrammatical and suspect verbiage
/* Imports and globalization */ yes, one guy says this. It makes no sense and can't possibly be true, but that's beside the point.
/* Imports and globalization */ qualify per source, it helps to read them
"The retailer has a clear policy for suppliers: On basic products that don't change, the price Wal-Mart will pay, and will charge shoppers, must drop year after year."
/* Imports and globalization */ The reference doesn't say there is any hard and fast rule that prices must go down each year. Source also supports other statements
/* Use of illegal workers */ not that we would doubt the "feds"
/* Wages */ that's what the reference says, it's not as definitive. I don't like the "some say"
rm text re: some edits coming from wal-mart computers; this isn't happening anymore, and hasn't for at least 2 years.
/* Imports and globalization */ What does this have to do with imports or globalization? also dup source
/* Imports and globalization */ restore more deleted text that is explicitly supported by the cited source
/* Use of illegal workers */ there were convictions and deportations -- that's not just "accused"
/* Use of illegal workers */ rm specious "critics claim" and repl "critics" with original "federal investigators" lol
/* Wages */ rm dup, deletion was just moved
/* Wages */ no statement in source as to whether they did or did not take into account average workers' hours; restore deletions
/* Economic impact */ rm "somehow" as the cause is stated
if it's in an external source, it's not a self-reference
/* Use of illegal workers */ POV adjustment, reference is POV piece from activists
/* Use of illegal workers */ what's wrong with "illegal immigrants" ? Better than "illegals" or "aliens". Removed speculative statement not supported by source & clarified 1st sentence of section
/* Use of illegal workers */ improved a little
there hasn't been any follow up for this idea, it's more like "original research"
/* Use of illegal immigrants */ maybe this is better. We'll cover all the bases
rv; 'illegal immigrants' is the proper term, and it is neither "flowery" nor "euphemistic".
what would be the reason for this change? Usually, the simpler more direct word is better than the flowery or euphemistic
maybe this rewording is better. This is not a "study," it's simply a claim made by the labor union.
Revert to revision 162614126 dated 2007-10-06 06:14:07 by Derek.cashman using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
/* Employee and labor relations */ added wal mart jobs in demand data
/* Wages */ another rewording, maybe better -- see commentary on the problem with this study
rv wage edits by SecretaryNotSure (sorry, I don't see a POV problem here, and you've eliminated some notable references and replaced them with far less notable ones).
/* Wages */ wage study too pov, see talk. tried to be npov as possible
/* Imports and globalization */ edits as noted
/* Economic impact */ references go after punctuation.
/* Economic impact */ adding depth of understanding of subject matter
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 162017653 by [[Special:Contributions/SecretaryNotSure|SecretaryNotSure]] ([[User talk:SecretaryNotSure|talk]])That doesn't clarify. That made it vague.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 162022127 by [[Special:Contributions/SecretaryNotSure|SecretaryNotSure]]Stop removing sourced information. Everything you reverted is backed by the reference.
/* Economic impact */ ref doesn't support "significant impact" "significant" means different things in different contexts
/* Imports and globalization */ "power?" "requirement for prices to go down each year?" not supported. no evidence any program "was cancelled"
image looks goofy, has no relevance, and makes criticism of walmart look amateurish
changing [[marijuana]] to [[cannabis (drug)]] link, Replaced: [[marijuana]] â [[cannabis (drug)|marijuana]] using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
rephrase info in lead re: labor unions (minor grammatical fixes to make sentence easier to read, really).
rm unnecessary sentence re: labor unions from 1st paragraph; the labor unions are discussed in the 2nd paragraph.
rm quotes (the cited material is not a direct quote).
rm unnecessary comment from article text.
add reference and rephrase sentence to actually match what is being cited.
rm unsourced and totally inaccurate statement.
rm another unnecessary fact tag (the two sentences are being cited by the three cites at the end of the second sentence).
citation really not needed on this statement (common knowledge).
/* Allegations of predatory pricing and supplier issues */ same as previous, only I hope it works this time. ;)
/* Allegations of predatory pricing and supplier issues */ correcting error in ref
/* Economic impact */ Even though we know it's true, it's still a superlative claim and must be referenced.
- numbering. It doesn't look good and is not necessary.
/* Allegations of predatory pricing and supplier issues */ copy-edit
/* Working conditions */ Adding back source text.
removing that excess "scare quotes" and added depth of knowlege item
I'm going to be bold and remove the 'government funds' section (it's very short, and not really about Wal-Mart, as other corporations take advantage of this, too; it's a larger issue than Wal-Mart).
rv 'attacks with zeal' phrase. That is setting a certain tone which I think is going a bit too far; and the words are a bit too strong, unusual, and don't really help the article.
yes, some of the language in the Taxes section was biased + toward the company. Maybe this is more Npov
Rv unsupported claims, unencyclopedic wording, and pointless information.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 160897013 by [[Special:Contributions/SecretaryNotSure|SecretaryNotSure]]Changes not supported by reference, worded unencyclopedia. Discuss changes on talk page.
/* Taxes */ rewrite Npov on insuring workers. Critics say some workers aren't important. Wal-Mart says all workers are important.
/* Government funds */ oops, darn keyboard. Fixed it here
/* Allegations of predatory pricing and supplier issues */ more info from references. German court ref is "dubious" but left in for fairness
/* Working conditions */ cut extraneous details in long article! Added Wal-Mart's side of dispute. Added balancing info on "prison" issue from reference
Rv:It's a balanced statement that covers all possiblities including "legitimate concern". Moving citation. Removing caption, adding alternate text to image.
/* Economic impact */ "has lead" changed to "has led" (past-tense verb)
Made an image... remove it if it doesn't look good.
Perhaps he reverted recent edits because they removed sourced information and introduced inaccurate information.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 160517947 by [[Special:Contributions/Derek.cashman|Derek.cashman]] ([[User talk:Derek.cashman|talk]]) Reverting recent edits makes little to no sense at all
rv back a few edits (recent flurry of anon edits make little to no sense at all).
you're right, the word "callous" and "imply" are not neutral.
/* Wages */ Callus relates to skin, whereas callous is the word you were looking for. Turns out we didn't need it after all, though!
Penn and Teller are comedians, not reliable sources
Reworded and improved the opening a bit
/* Overseas labor concerns */ fixed reference oops
/* Overseas labor concerns */ "reforms" suggests there have been "reforms" Added balancing view of critical film
/* Use of illegal immigrants */ consist use of terms. NPOV
/* Allegations of predatory pricing and supplier issues */ added balancing info
/* Allegations of predatory pricing and supplier issues */ changed vague accusations to something more definite
we don't know if wal-mart HIRED anyone to do this, or if this was the PR dept, or just someone at wal-mart. also the reference actually says "minor" edits and correcting errors.
I've tried to incorporate the criticism. But the references just don't support accepting "their unethical practices" as a fact -- that's what the crtiics say.
/* Store openings */ combined, removed repeated stuff. Tried to figure out what first paragraph was saying.
/* Economic impact */ more on "stuides" p.s. thank you for correcting - sorry for the spelling error.
Changed knowlege to knowledge and reverting vandalism
/* Health insurance */ oops, mean to hit show preview. reworded for NPOV
/* Economic impact */ U of P says study is opinion of professors only, not the university
expanded info on theories of Wal-Mart criticism movement
/* Economic impact */ removed reference to "studies show" - instead is self evident
/* Labor union opposition */ reference does not support "compensation ordered" it says "will hold hearings to determine if..."
/* Labor union opposition */ I did the best I could ...
/* Wages */ moved paragraph to political activities, reworded wage analysis to perspective of critics
/* Wages */ removed duplicated paragraph on taxpayer burden
/* Economic impact */ not accurate to call wal mart job "min wage"; corrected study of burden on taxpayer
/* Store openings */ reference does not support "graves desecrated" it says graves were reburried
new heading. Iowa voter education in new "political activity" heading. New reference, old one was "broken link"
re-write for NPOV ... off to a good start?
added a lead-in sentence to set overall context better
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 157056282 by [[Special:Contributions/71.75.233.195|71.75.233.195]] The use of impact is based off of the titles of sources used, which you can't rename.

rm blatant linkspam and advertisement to laurionconsulting.com. Wikipedia is not a venue for advertising websites, and the link was most definitely not a "reference".

partial revert of anonymous editor; the new version didn't make much sense.
/* Economic impact */ revert last edit by anon; statement is copied from the article verbatim, so marked with quotes
Addition of new information reported April 16, 2007.
/* Store openings */ made the links into proper references, moved one to the other side of the period, added fact tag, changed "dessecrated" to "desecrated" (desecrated != NPOV) & "TN" to "Tennessee"
/* External links */ Adding link that was inappropriately included in body.
/* Allegations of predatory pricing and supplier issues */ there should be no external links included in body.
Punctuation only goes inside of quotation marks for full quotes per [[WP:PUNC]].
rm link to list of divisions of wal-mart. It's just on their home page, and not really important on a criticism of wal-mart article.
rm link to site requiring login.
/* External links */ added two relevent links - check out the "walmart divisions" link from their own site.
rv unnecessary, flowery description of book.
